about_the_game:
You find yourself in the Australian outback with the bare minimum to survive. You are surrounded by Australian wildlife and most of it is as deadly as it comes. You have no memory of who you are and how you got here. You also find out that people appear to have abandoned this area.

Surviving in the Australian outback isn't easy - it is an extremely harsh environment with extreme temperatures, low rainfall, and little vegetation. The water is scarce. You will have to find your own strategy to survive, manage the heat and gather food.

Who are you and how did you get here?

Why are you alone?

Why did people leave this place?

How do you get back to civilisation?

And finally, are you really alone...

Survival

Australian wildlife isn't the friendliest in the world. Kangaroos and dingoes can be aggressive, but saltwater crocodiles or the eastern brown snake will most likely cause your death if you get too close to them.

You will have to develop your own strategy to survive. You can either approach them directly with a weapon you crafted earlier, or you can build traps and prepare poisoned baits.

However, wildlife isn't your biggest problem. Extreme temperatures and dehydration is what usually kills people stranded in the Australian outback. You must find water. You must find shade. You may consider sleeping through the heat of the day and explore the outback at a night time. Or you can gather as much water as you can and continue exploring. You may carefully plan the trip so you stay shaded for most of it. The choice is entirely up to you.

Build and Craft

Building system allows players to build the shelter as advanced or as simple as they want. It currently includes basic and advanced shelter levels, with a variety of items to chose from.

In addition to shelter, you will have to craft your weapons, traps, tools, and various other survival items.

Key Features

  • Immersive Australian Outback Setting: Experience the unique and challenging environment of the Australian Outback with its different biomes, each offering different environmental hazards and wildlife encounters.
  • Dynamic Ecosystem: Engage with a variety of wildlife, from prey you can hunt or trap for resources, to territorial predators like crocodiles and emus that necessitate advanced base building for survival.
  • Mystery and Discovery: Unravel a chilling truth about your surroundings as you explore and uncover new areas of the vast outback.
  • Progressive Crafting System: Unlock new recipes and improve your survival skills as you discover more about the area.
  • Resource Scavenging and Management: Collect and manage resources to survive in a harsh environment where water is scarce and shade is precious.
  • Creative Base Building: Construct and fortify your base in any way you see fit to protect yourself from wildlife and the harsh conditions of the outback.
  • Dynamic Weather and Day/Night Cycle: Adapt to a constantly changing environment with a dynamic day and night cycle, unpredictable weather patterns, and varying temperatures that impact gameplay.
  • Shade Detection Mechanics: Utilize shade to protect yourself from the blistering heat of the outback. Ensure you stay in shaded areas and plan your journeys carefully to avoid heat exhaustion.

short_description: Alone in the Outback is a story-driven survival experience. Traverse through the Australian outback, survive deadly heat of the day and cold of the night. Stay hydrated and choose your strategy to survive the dangerous Australian wildlife. Explore the territory to find out why you are here alone...
